dt: {bc}a fabric case filled with resilient material (such as cotton, hair, feathers, foam rubber, or an arrangement of coiled springs) used either alone as a bed or on a bedstead
{bc}a soft, airtight case that is designed to be inflated and used as a bed {bc}{sx|air mattress||}
{bc}a device (as of interwoven brush and poles) used to protect a shoreline, bank, or streambed from erosion

et: Middle English {it}materas{/it}, from Anglo-French, from Medieval Latin {it}materacium{/it}, from Arabic {it}maṭraḥ{/it} place where something is thrown
shortdef: a fabric case filled with resilient material (such as cotton, hair, feathers, foam rubber, or an arrangement of coiled springs) used either alone as a bed or on a bedstead
a soft, airtight case that is designed to be inflated and used as a bed : air mattress
a device (as of interwoven brush and poles) used to protect a shoreline, bank, or streambed from erosion

dt: {bc}a soft, airtight plastic case that is designed to be inflated and used as a bed

dt.t: And take it from my early 1960s-model spine, a modern {wi}air mattress{/wi}—cheap, simple to inflate and reliable—is something that many parents will find essential when sleeping in a tent.

shortdef: a soft, airtight plastic case that is designed to be inflated and used as a bed —called also air bed
